recital.text: The Stockbridge-Munsee Community is a federally recognized Indian tribe with inherent sovereign powers and is governed by the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council pursuant to the 1937 Constitution, as amended;
The Stockbridge-Munsee Community has the authority under its Constitution and its inherent rights as a sovereign nation to adopt and amend Ordinances;
Chapter 49, the Election Ordinance, establishes the system that the Tribe uses to conduct impartial and equitable elections;
In an advisory referendum held as part of the 2017 election, the majority of voters supported the addition of a primary election to the annual election cycle;

Along with adding a primary election, the Tribal Council wishes to update Chapter 49 to add a contested ballot process, clarify that the ordinance is used as guidance for conducting recall elections and address how election appeals are handled by the Election Board and Tribal Court;
the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council hereby adopts the amendments to Chapter 49, which make the following changes:

Shannon Holsey, President Jerilyn Johnson, Secretary
